p: The patients were stratified according to the presence or absence of immunosuppression. The immunosuppressed group included patients with hematological diseases (for example chronic myeloid leukemia), patients under immunosuppressive treatment regimens for malign or benign diseases, HIV positive patients and patients after solid organ or allogeneic bone marrow transplantation. Severe hepatitis was defined as the presence of compromised coagulation with an international normalized ratio (INR) greater or equal to 1.5. Chronic HEV infection was defined as a persistence of HEV replication for three months.
